noun.description: An expedition to keep watch over an area, especially by guards or police walking or driving around at regular intervals.
examples: we were ordered to investigate on a night patrol

noun.description: A unit of six to eight Girl Scouts or Boy Scouts forming part of a troop.

verb.description: Keep watch over (an area) by regularly walking or traveling around or through it.
examples: the garrison had to patrol the streets to maintain order
pairs of men were patrolling on each side of the thoroughfare

origin: Mid 17th century (as a noun): from German Patrolle, from French patrouille, from patrouiller paddle in mud, from patte paw + dialect ( gad)rouille dirty water.
